title: Parcel Change Log
description: A. SUMMARY Lookup table for City lots (Parcels), which enables the tracking which lots were the successor lots for the new lots created. The data is in changelog format, meaning each row is a change of parcel_id -- containing both the old parcel id and the new parcel_id. B. HOW THE DATASET IS CREATED This dataset is extracted from the SFGIS database C. UPDATE PROCESS This dataset will update daily D. HOW TO USE THIS DATASET Use this dataset to track and analyze how parcels have changed over time. E. RELATED DATASETS Parcels Active and Retired Map of Active Parcels

columns.name: recordedid
columns.description: Public Works ID for recorded transaction

columns.name: data_as_of
columns.description: Timestamp row was updated in the source system.

columns.name: data_loaded_at
columns.description: Timestamp row was uploaded to the open data portal.

whom_it_may_interest: Urban planners, developers, and researchers interested in land use and changes in city parcels.

queries.Monthly: SELECT date_trunc_ym(recordeddate) AS month, COUNT(*) AS changes, blklot, oldblklot WHERE recordeddate>='2022-09-01' GROUP BY month, blklot, oldblklot ORDER BY month
queries.Yearly: SELECT date_trunc_y(recordeddate) AS year, COUNT(*) AS changes, blklot, oldblklot WHERE recordeddate>='2022-09-01' GROUP BY year, blklot, oldblklot ORDER BY month
